comments.commentBody:
and Elke
Turns out that the SUN DOG site is case sensitive:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sun_dogs
Sorry.

Still denying to take responsibility of what you westerners have done and deflecting the blame on chinese government again? So unoriginal. Your continuing attempt to make china crumble is all too conspicuous. China does not need to resort to conspiracy theories to prop itself up: just one look at Trump is enough to make average chinese laugh at the west and their democracy. The real glaring failures are the western democracies, the problems china is facing pales in comparison to america and western europe's.
I remember the western educated korean democracy advocates demanding the fall of the military junta, the junta that finally lifted koreans from poverty and protected them from north, and when the military did step down those democracy activists gutted the economy and unleashed pro north korean sympathizers into the streets. Korea is only a shadow of its glory days: the country is overrun by pro north activists with unemployment sky high and cost of living soaring. The chinese government is not going to let the same thing happen in their country.

Crackdown of tiananmen, expulsion of dalai lama, banning falun gong and destorying unregistered places of worship are perfectly justifiable. They are no more than rebels posing a great threat to china and had to be liquidated. The chinese and russian goverments have nothing to fear: they know that their century has begun.

But I specifically state this:

"Which is that in the standard view a trade deficit makes no difference at all to the number of jobs in an economy, only to which jobs are being done."

I even say this:

"It's entirely true that trade changes which jobs are done within an economy--that's rather the point of it, to exploit comparative advantage and the division and specialisation of labour."

Which is indeed the standard view.

The more general EPI /Baker view is that trade deficits reduce jobs overall:

http://cepr.net/blogs/beat-the-press/forbes-tim-worstall-is-upset-the-tr...

The column freely mixed trade deficit with trade deficit in manufactured goods.

The US trade deficit, October 2016, was $42.6 billion. It consisted of a deficit of traded goods of $63.4 billion and surplus in traded services of $20.8 billion.

When the economy runs a trade deficit, we are talking about the aggregate of goods and services, not just manufactured goods. And traded goods are not just manufactured goods, they include foods, feeds, and beverages

In principle, its perfectly possible to run a trade surplus, with no manufactured goods as long as you have a strong service sector.

An analysis of the trade surplus/deficit of the City of London might be an interesting exercise.

"In principle, its perfectly possible to run a trade surplus, with no manufactured goods as long as you have a strong service sector."

And in reality we have only larger developed countries with balanced trade which either have industry or export raw materials.

You provide no evidence that servives can substitute for the loss of all industry.

What is the use of your London exercise? UK as a whole is the same boat as the USA.
Correct. Since trade deficits are the sum of goods and services, any analysis that does not separate the two re analysis of manufacturing employment is nonsense.
Now this is a very strong, very nice theme in a good Tuesday puzzle. Keep it up, Will. The festive poem, on the other hand, would have given me a headache had I let it.

lol

Multiple reasons to be reminded of Tom Lehrer (silent H) and his "Vatican Rhag" (cameo appearance for H).

LEAPSY??!!?!

Now you're just feeding me a load of Bull, "HALsy"!

When the Times presented Tomas Munitas' Baracoa, Cuba 1/12/2016, I checked to see whether a print could be ordered.  It could be, though I didn't get around to it.  Good to see the image again, though I wonder how many crucial events aren't portrayed in this year's collection.   I'm a bit surprised to find myself headed to central Cuba in a few weeks.  The trip was hastily arranged to visit palms in the wild while travel is relatively easy.

Professor Blackford,
Isn't this much more fundamental than economics. We have gone from the industrial age to the information age. In a society run by its technocracy isn't this the Technocracy's Areopagitica claiming ownership of the space between their ears as the most important part of social functioning?
Isn't what we've become a mediocracy run by the most disciplined but mediocre of minds. Most of the world's money is in the hands of people who have no idea of the responsibility and obligation of possessing the society's lifeblood.
Isn't it just normal that in a society run by and for technocrats that the money should all be in the hands of technocrats or their enablers?
Isn't this the same story of what happened in ancient Athens before Solon became the philosopher king and forgave all private debt so that Athens' best and bright could be released from indentured servitude?
Economics has been incredible at creating massive concentrated wealth but isn't it time to call in the philosophers, sociologists and psychologists? Hasn't economics become theatre?

Those who do not learn from experience are doomed to repeat it. We as a country do not learn from our experiences, and we respect people in public life who refuse on principal to learn from their experiences, and continue to seek out their opinions.

We do not learn from experience because experience will teach us that our values or ideologies are unworkable or produce the very things they are designed to avoid. Getting rid of Saddam did not make the area more stable by thwarting his attempts to join Pakistan in the nuclear club. What we got is arguably worse than another Pakistan or even North Korea.
Very quick Tuesday solve.

Philosophy is the starting point, the reason why we are here now. Western civilization stand upon philosophy as the alternative of Christian Faith that didn't work to solve problems. Philosophical argument about our conception of life and the world will going to shape our future. Should we kicked out philosophy after all?

Anti-Zionism is no more anti-Semitic than being anti-slavery or anti- Jim Crow America or anti-apartheid South Africa were anti-white.

White European Zionist Jewish Israel is in message and practice anti-black African, anti-Christian, anti-Muslim, anti-Arab, anti-Hindu, anti-Buddhist and anti-democratic.

There is no Jewish nor Christian nor Muslim "race" outside of Aryan Nazi fascist mythology.

In Zionist Jewish Israel the 6.1 million Jewish Israelis deny the equal certain unalienable rights of life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness the 6 million Christian Muslim Arab Muslim Israelis under their dominion by occupation, boycott/siege, exile and 2nd class citizenship.

Neither a Zionist Jewish state of Israel nor an Islamist Muslim state of Palestine would be confused with a civil secular plural egalitarian democracy. The Arab Palestinian Muslims were not the perpetrators of the diasporas, crusades, inquisitions, pogroms and ghettoes and genocides including the Holocaust against the Jews of Europe.

The two-state solution is a delusional anachronism from an age of European Empires, Jim Crow America and the Soviet Union.

The denial of the Jewish people to self-determination in a state of their own, as prescribed by the U.N. in UNGAR 181, providing for two states, "One Arab and One Jewish," is anti-Semitic. The supreme disingenuousness and hypocrisy of the South African "Apartheid" canard is that while South Africa, where 90% of the population is black or mixed race, enjoys majority rule, yet Israel, which is 80% Jewish, would be denied majority rule under any "one state" scheme. Yes, the Palestinians should have a state of their own in which they would also enjoy majority rule, but they will not achieve it through continuous "wars of aggression" against their Israeli Neighbors.

Successive "wars of aggression" against Israel, all of which have failed, and refusal to negotiate "secure and recognized boundaries" for both states per UNSCR 242 and 338, have resulted in continued "occupation" of captured and disputed territory. Under International Law, Israel as the victorious belligerent of the 1967 "Six Day War," is entitled to retain captured land until possession is modified by peace treaty. See: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uti_possidetis
(Latin: As you possess, you may continue to possess.)

As with the Post World War II occupations of Germany and Japan, occupations end with negotiated peace treaties. When Palestinians are as serious about self-determination, as opposed to Imperial ambitions of conquest, they will negotiate a solution leading to statehood.

America was born in humanity denying black African enslavement and equality defying colored Jim Crow discrimination.

A physically identifiable colored American minority carrying the historical burdens of their American history is the measure of the vast hypocritical inhumane immoral distance between American verbal and written rhetoric and governing socioeconomic political reality.

The reality is that a half-white by biological DNA genetic evolutionary nature and all white by cultural nurture man named Barack Hussein Obama is not half-white by nature nor all white by nurture in America in 2016.

There are more German Americans than there are any other kind of Americans. And American immigration policy once favored white Protestant men from North and Western Europe.

There is only one multicolored multi-ethnic, multi-faith and multi-national origin human race species working American class. The Republican Party won 57%, 59% and 58% of the white American vote in 2008, 2012 and 2016.

Trump "won" election as the next POTUS despite the fact that 54% of Americans did not vote for him. Trump won fewer voters and a lower percentage of voters than Mitt Romney. America does not have a national election. There are 50 state elections plus the District of Columbia competing for Electors.

Vladimir Putin is bemused and admiring of the ability of the Electoral College to frustrate the Presidential election vote.

Every news website reflects a bias about what news is worth reporting and how it should be reported and to what audience and for what purpose.  Moderated comments sections reflecting a variety of views are the most fruitful and fair. Using nom de plumes for individual commentators is understandable for those who have been verbally and physically harassed by a variety of means and methods.  Any failure lies with the commenters.

The Orlando attack was directed at a club frequented by brown Latino/Hispanic LGTBQ members. Their ethnicities and national origin were targeted. Was their LGBTQ status a target?

The LGTBQ were naturally and normally created by God and Mother Nature, Christians are in no position to judge nor cast any stones at the LGBTQ. The LGBTQ are naturally divinely created equal Americans with certain unalienable rights of life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness.

Did Jesus and his twelve disciples go on a three year gay pride parade? Is Catholic clergy a refuge for LGBTQ?

America has no religion nor denies any religion. America has freedom for both belief and non-belief.

Priceless comment! That cosy comparison made my day (night actually)

Merry Christmas over there across the ocean!

The premise has issues. It is always easier to create chaos than it is build something that lasts. Russia is a fraction of the size of the American economy but it has just enough to cause problems globally. If you cannot win, you try to prevent your competitors from succeeding.

Come to think of it, what party in the U.S. thinks that way?

Actually there WERE cases of hacking in the Congressional races on the Democratic side. What I want to know is why Trump's personal garbage (most be tons of that) was not put on the front lawn for everyone to see or why whatever was taken from the hacks into the RNC wasn't released. Convenient ....
Wrong. China didn't develop its current manufacturing base until the 1990s after Japan's economy and markets imploded.
Political Correctness is just Common Decency.

Of course. Political correctness has nothing to do with silencing dissent. It has nothing to do with fascism and authoritarian states. It's just about being decent by censoring yourself on absolutely anything that might even possibly offend someone else. And if you still manage to offend someone else, you'll have one more thing to censor next time. Good one.

Republicans have never shown any concern for the children of working class White people.  I was poor in the 60/70's and even then the Democrats were trying to help out with job programs  for teenagers (Job Opportunities for Youth and CETA and others).  The Republicans were against all of those programs and cut them as soon as they got power.  Republicans are against college support and health care, child care, and help for small business, etc. etc.  Their attitude is "you are on your own! They believe in trickle down economics, help the rich make more money and somehow that is going to help the rest of us-- right!  Luckily for many of us, there were more opportunities back in the 80's. But today, no help and the competition has exploded. Political correctness is about being polite.  Do the people who voted for Trump -- against their interests want liberals to keep calling them idiots?  How about we just say they needed a voice.  That is what political correctness is about.  It is about being polite and learning how to communicate in a way that's not offensive to other people!

Why say that Trump supporters voted against their interests? Maybe the supporter is out of work, employed only part time, does not want to continue Middle East nation building - and voted for the only candidate - at the end - who voiced these and other non racist concerns.

The USA has maintained normal relations with the ROC before Jan. 1st, 1979. While the international environment has shifted since, it can be done, and I don't think Trump is proposing anything of that nature, that being restoring normal relations with the ROC. That country also maintains that it is the sole, legitimate government of all China. The severing of relations with Taiwan is referred there as 中美斷交, i.e. "Sino-American Break", reflecting its position that the PRC is an illegal regime established in consequence of an insurrection.

The One China Policy is one that has two sides. People forget that the ROC also maintains this policy; any country that has relations with the PRC are not allowed to enjoy the same with the ROC.
